item.title: Adding attribute to python module programmatically
item.description: Problem Time to time appears the need to add extra module's attributes programmatically during the initialization of module. Let's consider the something like loading raw SQL queries from some folder in project where we want just keep all raw SQL queries. So usally we would write in raw_sql_queries/__init__.py something like this: import sys import logging import os.path def load_raw_sql_query(query_name): try: file_name = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), query_name + '.sql') return open(file_name).read().strip() except OSError as er: logger.
